name: places/ChIJN3vmuR9awokR8RoytRbpbrE
formattedAddress: 111 Murray St, New York, NY 10007, USA
adrFormatAddress: 111 Murray St, New York, NY 10007, USA

originalText.text:
Attached is a video of the noise you will have to deal with on any relatively windy day caused by the building creaking. So loud it wakes you up during the night and keeps you awake all night. This occurs majority of nights, especially in the winter.

If you get a unit in East tower, be prepared to only have ONE functioning elevator for 64 floors for the majority of the time you live here. One elevator is always broken. Repairs take 3-4 weeks every time a elevator breaks. As soon as one is repaired, the other breaks within a week. In the almost year I’ve lived here, I’ve been lucky enough to have both elevators working for maybe 2 weeks in the entire year. You will wait 10-15 minutes for the elevator every single time you leave your apartment — I now have learned to leave my apartment 20 minutes before I really need to in order to allow for the elevator wait.

Building staff is friendly but extremely high turnover in management. In one year, I think we’re now on our third management company. Couldn’t even tell you who manages the building right now.

Building is always packed, it feels like you live in a city within a city. Tons of people in the lobby, elevator is cramped and packed every time. Can’t go outside without bumping into 20-30 people at any given time. If you’re looking for any sort of privacy, this building is the worst possible option.

If you want a luxury building, I would go elsewhere. Simply said, this is a horrifically designed building.

originalText.text: A quite nice place, surrounded by a variety of shops and restaurants, very close to the train

originalText.text: I was touring buildings in Tribeca to buy. Went to every luxury high rise and this has to be the worst. Is this an actual scam? The hallways look unfinished and so unrefined. The lobby looks very cookie cutter. The gym looks like an equinox. The units??? Don’t even get me started… the cheapest materials a building could use. The walls & kitchen look so cheap and the ceilings are only 10-11 feet. This is more like a singles haven building… too many one bedrooms here. they were probably trying to compete with 56 Leonard, and Robert AM STERN projects in the neighborhood but there is no comparison whatsoever.

originalText.text: This building doesn't have sufficient flood insurance. Hence, may not able to get the loan from many banks as they don't offer loans under such conditions. Even if you wan to purchase your own flood insurance for unit, many insurance companies don't quote for it given what the building provides. And even if offer to purchase flood insurance covering the unit, banks don't offer loan as the building is not sufficiently covered.
